A compilation of ten Electronic Arts games for the Macintosh on CD-ROM:

  • Around the World in 80 Days: A Creative Reader
  • Chuck Yeager's Air Combat
  • Eagle Eye Mysteries in London
  • PGA Tour Golf II
  • Populous II: Trials of the Olympian Gods
  • Powermonger
  • Power Poker
  • Syndicate
  • The Labyrinth of Time
  • Theme Park
title: Top Ten Mac Pak

description:
This DLC bundle for Call of Duty: Black Ops - Mac Edition includes two previously-released DLC packs:

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops - Annihilation
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops - Escalation
title: Call of Duty: Black Ops - Annihilation & Escalation

description: Silka no Tō (or The Tower of Silka) is a fantasy-themed RPG that follows an adventurer as she explores a tower in search of treasure. It plays like other Japanese dungeon crawlers; the player uses the mouse to navigate a first-person dungeon and engage in one-on-one turn-based battles. Outside combat, the player can rest to recover HP and search to try to find hidden treasures and items.

sample_screenshots.caption: We're greeted at the entrance by a fairy. And our journey begins here...
We meet our protagonist - she's on her way to the tower.
Here we are... are we ready?

title: Silka no Tō

description:
A careless angel flying high above PSY・S City accidentally drops seven special hearts that govern the night. When the purple heart flutters through the window and lands in the player's living room, they set out to find the other six and restore them to heaven.

The Seven Colors is a first-person multimedia point-and-click adventure game. The ultimate goal of finding the hearts is more or less just a framing device giving the players a reason to explore, but travelling through the city to see what it has to offer is very much its own reward. The environment is full of neat sights and weird things to discover, all set to music by band PSY・S and one of its members, Masaya Matsuura.

This was the first game designed by Matsuura, coming several years before his work on Tunin' Glue and Parappa the Rapper. Matsuura had previously worked on the soundtrack to Metamor Jupiter with PSY・S bandmate Mami Yasunori.

sample_screenshots.caption: Turning out the lights here gives us some dramatic lighting.
...the city on the other wall glows.
Wow, the Channel Blue building really dominates this space.
Stepping inside the Channel Blue building. Probably best to start with the receptionist.

title: The Seven Colors: Legend of PSY・S City

description: A young woman becomes her hometown's champion hoverbike racer; in search for a challenge, she sets out to dethrone the world's champions and become the very best. HoverSpeeder is a time trial-based racing game. In each of the five stages, the player must beat its current champion's time to move on. Gameplay takes after classic Sega arcade racers like Hang-On; gameplay is presented using sprite-scaling, and the player controls their driver from a third person rear perspective. While there are many other drivers on the track, they're more obstacles than real opponents; the player's goal is time, not to get first in the race.

sample_screenshots.caption: Annie doesn't seem too upset about losing her record.
With that penguin cheering me on I don't see how I could lose.
The road starts to get a bit more congested in this stage.
Be careful not to hit anything on the side of the road.

title: HoverSpeeder

description:
A compilation of the five games from the La La Land series, ported to Macintosh:

  • La La Land
  • La La Land 2
  • La La Land 3
  • La La Land 4
  • La La Land 5
title: La La Land Series

description:
When Tessy LaFemme goes missing, her friend Tracker McDyke must put her detective skills to use and scour The Castro in San Francisco to track her down.

This graphic adventure mystery game puts the player in the role of the detective. Its gameplay is presented through a mix of a point-and-click interface and a text parser. The player can click on items in the main game screen to interact with them. Verb icons give the player extra ways to interact, and some of these require the player to type what they want to do.

An edited version was released under the title Murder on Main Street due to concerns a publisher would refuse to accept an LGBT-themed game. This version was released for free as charityware; the author requested that players donate to AIDS charities if they enjoyed the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Couples enjoying a 3:30AM meal at the Red Herring Cafe.
So that's why the owner of the Gayme Room looked so upset...
Opening screen - just after leaving the Gayme Room for the night.

title: Caper in the Castro

description:
When Tessy LaReau goes missing, her friend Tracker MacDuff must put her detective skills to use and scour Main Street to track her down.

This graphic adventure mystery game puts the player in the role of the detective. Its gameplay is presented through a mix of a point-and-click interface and a text parser. The player can click on items in the main game screen to interact with them. Verb icons give the player extra ways to interact, and some of these require the player to type what they want to do.

This is an edited version of the game originally released as Caper in the Castro. This version was produced out of concern that a publisher would not be willing to carry an LGBT-themed game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Compared to the original game, the people at the cafe have been swapped around. No gay couples allowed in computer games, clearly.
Introduction - a few details are missing this time around.
The Game Room is a little more staid in this telling.

title: Murder on Main Street

description:
This Wizardry-style dungeon crawling RPG is typical of the games of its era. The player controls a custom party of adventurers who enter a dungeon in search of treasure.

This game's source code was the basis of GayBlade. When the author went unpaid by the publisher for his work on this game, he used its source code as the basis for making a self-published RPG.
title: Citadel of the Dead

description:
MacCommand is a Missile Command variant. Like in other games of its kind the objective is to protect a city from being destroyed by air attacks. The game is played with the mouse which is used to move a crosshair around the screen. Enemies will fly across the screen and drop projectiles towards the city which initially is protected by a force field. Clicking with the mouse or pressing the space bar launches a missiles from one of three missile bases (depending on which is nearest the target) which destroys any target that is within its range of explosion. As buildings are destroyed people fall from them onto the streets where ambulances will arrive and pick them up. The game ends when all buildings have been destroyed.

There are several different types of enemies including balloons, helicopters and dive bombers. They all drop bombs that can do damage to the city if not shot down in time. There are also paratroopers which if they manage to reach the ground will run to a missile base and destroy it permanently. Missile bases that are destroyed by bombs are rebuilt for every new level. Firing missiles damages the city's force field while destroying a target restores it. Hence accurate shooting is rewarded.

sample_screenshots.caption: The city is starting to take some heavy damage
A paratrooper is about to land

title: MacCommand

description: MacPlaymate II is the in-name sequel to MacPlaymate, though it’s more of a color remake of the original monochrome game, with some added dialogue. The goal is to safisfy the woman using costumes, fingers and sex toys, as well as both male and female partners.
title: MacPlaymate II

description: Avara is a 3D-rendered, flat-shaded networked battle arena game in which players control walking robot mechs. The robots are armed with lasers, missiles, and grenades, and protected by shields. Up to six players can battle simultaneously, using built-in level maps or add-on maps created by players and downloaded from the net. Three different mech configurations are available, varying in speed and loadout. There are also some single player scenarios for solo exploration. Action is either viewed first-person, from inside the mech, or third-person, from a flying drone that is player controllable.
title: Avara

alternate_titles.title: Near Miss: The Air Traffic Control Simulator

description:
Air Traffic Control Simulator simulates the stressful job of an air traffic controller, putting the player in charge of all of the air traffic in their sector. The player views the sector through a large radar screen, with status panels indicating clocks, wind, and ever-changing flight schedules, and must direct the plane's and helicopter's routes and altitudes, with little margin for error.

The player can select from a fleet of up to 60 aircraft, 5 airports, modifiable weather conditions, and local terrain.
title: Air Traffic Control Simulator

description:
A collection of the following games:

  • Command & Conquer
  • Heroes of Might and Magic
  • Shock Wave Assault 2: Beyond the Gate
  • Return to Zork
  • A-10 Cuba!
  • Blood Bath at Red Falls
  • MacAttack - a Tempest-style title (not to be confused with the MSX title of the same name)
  • SimTower
  • Trophy Bass
  • Bridge Master

This collection is notable for being the only release of the Macintosh version of "Shock Wave 2: Beyond the Gate" (called "Shockwave Assault 2: Beyond the Gate" on its CD).
title: MacPack Blitz

description:
A futuristic Japan-only RPG for the Macintosh set in Oedo, a gigantic city floating in space around Earth's moon. Remains of a highly-advanced civilization were found when the city was built, in the form of "mech" technology. You play as a young samurai apprentice that begins to have ominous dreams about his father and must solve the mystery behind a group of mysterious ninjas.

Samurai Mech's main quality are its amazing presentation and art work. The artist made full use of the Macintosh graphical abilities and created a gorgeous game, with each illustration, menu and even the combat screen building up to the game's "Space-Japan" aesthetic.

sample_screenshots.caption: Acquiring a blueprint used for crafting

title: Samurai Mech

description:
Nuke Snake is a 2 player versus game and a variant on the classic Snake game. From a top down view, each player controls a snake's head on the same map area. They must move forward across the field to new locations, avoiding obstacles but also avoid crashing into their trail or tail of where they have already been. In addition, each player in Nuke Snake has 5 bullets that they can fire straight ahead to try to kill the other player's snake head. A point is scored when the other player is killed, either via shooting or them crashing into an obstacle.

Each map contains a variety of terrain types including forests, rivers, mountains and ice. Some of these terrain types can be navigated over, some slow down the player and some count as crashing and will kill the player.
title: Nuke Snake

description: Wacky Jacks is a "CD Game Show" hosted by a clown named Wacky, and featuring Don Pardo of Jeopardy! and Saturday Night Live fame as announcer. The game show is composed of four available rounds, which can be mixed and matched in any order and number. In Slap Happy, players must match as many pairs of photos as possible before time runs out, somewhat like Concentration. Zingers is a quiz game in which players connect squares in a line, tic-tac-toe-style, by answering trivia questions about the photos in the grid. The Hangman-inspired Blankety Blank involves choosing photos representing the correct letters to fill in a word or phrase. Finally, Scrambler is a swap puzzle. The game also includes the Album, a catalog of all photos used in the game with descriptions of their subjects.
title: Wacky Jacks

description:
The MacCube was one of several shareware compilations released by Aztech New Media. It contains over 200 shareware programs, including home, business, and educational titles, as well as games.

The full list of games included in this compilation are as follows:

Arcade

  • Arashi
  • Armor
  • Chrysanthemum
  • Cyclone
  • Delirium
  • Eat My Photons!
  • Glypha III
  • Grizzly
  • Invaders!
  • MacBrickout
  • Maelstrom

Games

  • U-Review
  • Whales

The remaining titles in the compilation are mainly home and business titles, as well as graphics applications and utilities.
title: The MacCube

description:
MacPack Counter-Attack is one of several game compilations released by Aztech New Media for the Macintosh. Like other MacPack compilations, it had a featured title, in this case King's Quest VII, as well as several others, for a total of "10 Great Mac Titles On 5 CD ROMs to Counter Attack Boredom!"

While most of the titles included in this compilation are kid friendly, it also includes the decidedly adult-only Leisure Suit Larry 6.

MacPack Counter-Attack contains the following titles:

  • Roberta Williams' King's Quest VII: The Princeless Bride
  • SimCity Classic
  • Leisure Suit Larry 6: Shape Up Or Slip Out!
  • Lyriq Crosswords: The Player's Choice
  • Outpost
  • PegLeg
  • JumpRaven
  • Lunicus
  • Dr. T's Sing-A-Long Around The World
  • SpaceMadness
title: MacPack Counter-Attack

description:
MacPack Sneak Attack was the third in Aztech New Media's MacPack series of compilations. It contains 9 games across 4 CD-ROMs, including:

  • Descent
  • A-10 Attack!
  • Police Quest: Open Season
  • Blackthorne
  • Shadow Wraith
  • Brain Dead 13
  • The Even More! Incredible Machine
  • Gus Goes to the Kooky Carnival
  • Classic Text Adventure Masterpieces
title: MacPack Sneak Attack

description:
Chuck and Leo's really nifty adventure is a comedy adventure game released for HyperCard on the Macintosh that lampoons various spy film tropes. Starring Chuck (he's the rabbit one) and Leo (the lizard one), it features the two eponymous characters as they try to foil the plot of the dastardly "Mister Bad", an anthropomorphic smiley face.

Gameplay is of the point-and-click variety, with a choose-your-own-adventure style of play, that goes down various paths depending on where you send Chuck and Leo next. Most of the paths end in disaster for our duo, but with humorous results!

The game was created by Nick Longrich, who also went by the alias "Norbik Nudley", the filename of the HyperCard stack itself.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of Mister Bad's dastardly plots.
Can things get any worse for our heroes? At least there's tequila.

title: Chuck and Leo's really nifty adventure

description:
Spacestation Pheta is a shareware puzzle-platformer game for the original Macintosh. It superficially resembles Lode Runner but, unlike Lode Runner, the game is fundamentally turn-based rather than real-time, with an oxygen meter that drops with each step.

The goal of the game is to collect the keys and then reach the exit door before your oxygen runs out. The game complicates this by including features such as oxygen refill tanks which may be necessary to complete the level without suffocating, trampolines, and various other mechanics.

The shareware version allows you to play 10 levels, while the full version unlocks 100 levels, a level editor, and support for playing user-created levels.
title: Spacestation Pheta

description:
An unlicensed freeware implementation of the Hasbro board game of the same name which circulated in the late 1980s for the Apple Macintosh and Mac Plus.

It exists in at least two versions: The original release, which is exclusively a black-and-white game, and a third-party modification using RegEdit which retrofitted colour graphics.
title: Risk!

description: Tetrix is a Tetris variant game. Geometric shapes fall from the top of a playfield to rest on the bottom; fit the pieces together, and the line they form disappears. If the pieces don't form lines and eventually stack up to the top of the playfield, the game is over.
title: Tetrix

description:
Officially an add-on for the famous screen saver collection, After Dark (v2.0), More After Dark: Volume 1 was Berkeley Systems' first foray into games with its inclusion of the module Lunatic Fringe, "the exciting new space game from the creator of Solarian II." Although there was never any "Volume 2" of More After Dark, with the release of later editions of After Dark, more games would be included as screen saver modules. While After Dark was already a popular screensaver (arguably responsible for the screensaver craze of the 1990s), the games themselves proved popular enough to warrant a release of their own, known as After Dark Games, with games based on some of the other popular screensaver modules.

The actual game that was included, called Lunatic Fringe, is a simple top-down space shooter. Once the screensaver module has been activated, the keyboard is used to control the your ship, which can be flown in 360° space. As you explore, you encounter planets, asteroids, and enemy ships. From the mini-map you can observe when objects are approaching.

You begin the game at your home base. You must return there from time to time in order to refuel and/or repair your ship. One of the more novel elements of the game is that different parts of your ship can be damaged to varying degrees and, when damaged past a certain threshold, each element will begin to misbehave in a unique way, such as a disabled blaster or misbehaving thrusters.
title: More After Dark: Volume 1

description:
Mac FunPack is a collection of casual titles, mostly of the card and casino game variety, released for the Macintosh by MacSoft.

The Mac FunPack box boasts "5 hit titles. 36 games. Totally Mac. Totally fun." The total number of games though is inflated by multiple variations found within each title (with twenty-four of them being part of Absolute Solitaire alone).

The titles included with this collection are as follows:

  • Jack Nicklaus 4 (a golf title)
  • Casino Game Pack (includes: Blackjack, Video Poker, Roulette, Slots, Keno, and Draw Poker)
  • Absolute Solitaire
  • Game Parlor (includes: Chess, Checkers, Solitaire, and Crosswords)
  • Diamonds 3D: 3D Breakout Action! (a Breakout title)

The games are spread across two CDs. While Disc 2 contains Jack Nicklaus 4 only, Disc 1 contains the rest.

A second collection in the Mac FunPack series, Mac FunPack 2, would later be released.
title: Mac FunPack

description:
Jewel of Arabia: Dreamers is an RPG with a classic design. It shares similarities with other Macintosh RPGs such as Spiderweb Software's Exile series. The player creates a party of six characters and goes on adventures in a setting inspired by the stories of 1001 Nights.

Gameplay includes top-down exploration of the world and tactical turn-based combat in the style of the Gold Box games. Conversations with NPCs follow a keyword system where the player can type in words that NPCs will respond to. Character creation allows for some unusual additions to the party, such as a jinn or a pet monkey.

sample_screenshots.caption: A screenshot of the combat system in action.

title: Jewel of Arabia: Dreamers

description: Cythera is an RPG that could be described as the Ultima of the Macintosh, as it focuses on immersion and interactivity, just like the DOS classic Ultima VII. It features single-character world exploration, a high degree of interactivity with objects in the environment, a hunger system, and keyword-based dialogues.

sample_screenshots.caption: The initial conversation with the king.
Trying to use the conversation icon on your own character.
The character creation screen, where you choose between different classes and choose your sex and portrait.

title: Cythera

description:
MacCubed³ is the third release in Aztech's MacCube series, itself a part of Aztech's larger Cube series of shareware compilations. MacCubed³ is comprised of seven CD-ROMs, each containing a different genre(s) of free or shareware software, with the first three in particular being games-centric. Below is a listing of the games found on the first three discs.

Disc 1: Arcade* 3tris

  • Abuse Demo
  • Alien Action Dome
  • Ants Afire
  • Boom!
  • Breaker
  • Bubble Trouble
  • Burning Rubber
  • Centaurian
  • Dark Corona
  • Death From Above
  • Farm Patrol
  • Fracas
  • Galaxus
  • Hyperball
  • Marathon Infinity Demo
  • Meat Gone Bad
  • Monkey Shines
  • Oil Cap Pro
  • Quick Shot Deluxe
  • Robo War
  • Scruffy Stuff
  • Short Circuit
  • Skittles
  • Smack a Skunk
  • Weekend Warrior Demo (PPC)

Disc 2: Games* 3D Cannon

  • Avara
  • Code Book
  • Colorfall
  • Darkwood
  • Deco
  • Enigma
  • Exile
  • Exile II
  • Galactic Empire
  • Galactica
  • Labrat
  • Mine Sweeper
  • Nuclear War
  • Omega
  • Playmaker Football
  • Pyramad
  • Realmz 4.2.1
  • Reversi
  • Sea Battle
  • Siege of Darkwood
  • Simon Says
  • Sokoban 3-D
  • Space Debris
  • Stardust
  • Stratomatic Baseball
  • Sword Dream 3-D
  • Ultima III
  • Tetris Max
  • War Birds (PPC)

Disc 3: Kids’ Games* Beetle Run

  • Coloring Book
  • Concentroids

  • Real Domino Effect
  • Snood
  • Sound Toy

Card, Board & Puzzle Games* Card Table

  • Classic Gin Rummy
  • Flaps
  • Flower Puzzle
  • Genius
  • Ghost
  • Hearts Deluxe
  • Lites Out
  • Momentum
  • RChess
  • Ultimate Craps
  • Wacky Wheel
  • XWords
title: MacCubed³

description: In U-Boat the player controls a U-Boat from the German side in World War II. The player has to patrol the North Sea, but there are also other types of missions such as attacking Allied ships. Regularly it is necessary to return to the port to refuel. Many types of commands are performed on control panels and a lot of digitized pictures are used. A map view is used to plot courses, locate enemy ships and also control the submarine.
title: U-Boat

description:
MacLanding is a clone of the Williams arcade classic Defender.

The player controls a space fighter that is flying over a jagged planetary landscape on a mission to protect humanoids from the aliens. The player patrols the two-way scrolling landscape in his ship, disposing of aliens preventing them from abducting the humanoids. If the aliens manage to get a humanoid to outer space (top of the screen), it mutates and chases you down. You can rescue the humanoid by shooting the alien capturing it, but if it falls too far it will fall to its death. To avoid that your craft needs to swoop in to pick it up and return it safely to the surface. At the end of level, each surviving humanoid gives you a bonus score.

Your ship is equipped with lasers and a limited number of smart bombs and the the top of the screen is dedicated to a long range scanner that shows the location of all enemies and humanoids on the level.
title: MacLanding

description: A version of Santa Paravia and Fiumaccio rewritten from the ground up in C language.
title: Santa Paravia and Fiumaccio

description: The player takes the role of a storm chaser who is in the middle of a project to repel tornadoes, when the player is caught in a storm and plunged into the middle of a strange land. To return home and finish the project, the player must navigate through the land and solve puzzles. There are four commands including Look, Use, Talk and Inventory to interact with things and people in the background. The player can also rotate clockwise or anti-clockwise to face a different cardinal direction in the same location. All actions and descriptions are narrated in a rich text box.
title: Twisted!

description: Super Maze Wars is an updated version of the classic game Maze Wars. Players pilot polygonal MazeCruiser vehicles from a first-person perspective. Environments consist of simplified 3D labyrinths. Gameplay involves collecting gems and combat with enemy ships. Players may battle up to six AI enemies, or human opponents using local networking.
title: Super Maze Wars

description: Burning Monkey Mahjong Solitaire is a game in Freeverse's Burning Monkey series which features humorous monkeys telling jokes during game time. Like other mahjong solitaire games, the objective is to clear the board from tiles by matching tiles of the same kind. There are five difficulty levels and 35 different tile layouts. It's also possible to randomly generate new layouts. The game has a built-in hint feature that suggests a pair of tiles that can be matched or to show all tiles that can be matched. It is also possible to undo moves and reshuffle the board.

sample_screenshots.caption: Completing a game reveals a fortune cookie

title: Burning Monkey Mahjong Solitaire

description: In Ocean Bound a ship's crew is stranded some offshore island(s). The player has to ensure the crew's survival by gathering resources, building structures, making tools and fending off any threats. Any people in the player's crew depend on shelter and food to stay alive. The more people killed by threats of natural causes, the less chance of survival. Ultimately the player needs to get enough resources and people to build a boat that will allow them to escape the island.
title: Ocean Bound

description: There are many mysteries behind the galaxy. In Galactic Core the player chooses an alien race to explore the galaxy, colonize planets, research technology, build a fleet and fight other alien factions to determine who ultimately controls the galaxy. Regions in space that are not explored or shrouded by the fog of war. Objects such as nebulae prevent space units from setting a direct course. Colonizing and recruitment will cost the player credits and resources, which can be replenished from missions and from strategic actions on a planet under the player's control. Outside the main game, the player to able to create custom maps and campaigns.
title: Galactic Core

description: There is no peace in the afterlife, only eternal war. In Lost Souls the player controls an army of soldiers in a chess-like turn-based battle to conquer the realms of the afterlife. The game has three difficulty levels to choose from. The soldier units consist of footmen, archers and knights each of which have a limited number of moves per turn. The player will battle one, two or three opponents in each realm. In addition to placing and moving units, the player can also build bridges over gaps. Towers if under player control gave give a great advantage on the battlefield.
title: Lost Souls

description:
Harry the Handsome Executive is an action adventure set in an office environment at ScumCo at which Harry works. Harry is trying to work his way up the corporate ladder performing his office duties, but also by using some unorthodox means, like fighting his way past middle management, robots and machines, sliding through the offices while sitting on his swivel chair and using common office appliances and condiments as weapons and sustenance. Hopefully he can uncover some company secrets, like what the company actually does, and confront the ScumCo's President Dr. Ubermann about his latest chemical project.

The game screen shows a square office space with Harry scooting in his office chair (from which he never rises) from room to room with his inventory and status indicators in a box on the right side of the office area. Harry is given tasks to perform, and when completed he gains points, and has access to the next level. On the levels there are hazards, like other employees throwing darts across his path which can hurt Harry, and power-up items and keys for opening locked doors are scattered around the cubicles.

The shareware game has 5 levels playable without registering.
title: Harry the Handsome Executive

description: Brickles Plus is a Breakout variant and the successor to Ken Winograd's Brickles games, bringing color to the mix. It runs so fast as to be unplayable on newer machines.
title: Brickles Plus

description: Clock Shop is an educational program with exercises to familiarize children with telling time on analog and digital clocks. For instance, a digital clock needs to be adjusted until it matches the hands of an analog one.
title: Clock Shop

description: Coin Critters is a software program designed to teach students to recognize the face values of coins, match coin values, purchase items from word problems, and count change.
title: Coin Critters

description: Rodem the stray dog is back in Hyakujiri Park, left to survive on his own once more. Like in Yaken Rodem, players guide him via the mouse, clicking on the screen to move him and interact with the other inhabitants of the park. Clicking on Rodem switches him between several different moods, allowing him to interact with the park's other inhabitants in different ways. For example, when in a friendly mood Rodem can befriend other creatures he meets, while in an angry mood he can get into fights. Rodem needs food to survive and can eat just about anything he comes across, but depending on players' choices his life can take a very different turn. A new addition to this game is the parasitization system, in which Rodem can become infected with one of a few fantastical parasites within the park. These grow into strange objects poking out of his head and can have different effects.
title: Rodemcchi: Rodemshi - Norainu Densetsu

description:
The objective of Spaceway 2000 is to progress as far along the intergalactic freeway as you can before your ship is destroyed. Evade a plethora of enemies, pick up power-ups and reach the checkpoints to prolong your journey and install upgrades.

The 'spaceway' is a two dimensional scrolling plane with the main trajectory being bottom to top and some minor expansion to the sides. The gameplay dynamic feels similar to Asteroids for rotation, thrusting & firing.
title: Spaceway 2000

description:
Gopher Golf is a 1–4 player mini-golf game for the Macintosh.

The goal of Gopher Golf is — you guessed it — to hit the ball into the hole. But, watch out! Sometimes the gopher gets in the way. Landing your ball in one of his holes costs you a stroke. There are other hazards too. Water, hills, bridges, and more. Play alone, or set up your own tournament with up to three friends. Either way, there's hours of fun ahead for you playing Gopher Golf.

Contains a built in editor to create custom mini-golf holes.
title: Gopher Golf

description: Lenny and Rita is a freeware point-and-click adventure where private investigator Lenny Mead must take on a case for a woman who's lost something that isn't hers and is wanted by dangerous people. It is a case that will change Lenny's life forever, or if he's not careful, end it.
title: Lenny and Rita

description:
Join Lancer Squad, an elite unit of flight-capable troops, on their current mission to battle an extraterrestrial army set on taking control the universe's evil war machine. Active Lancer confronts you (and a companion if necessary) against waves of alien spacecraft, tanks, boats, and gun turrets over 15 stages of increasing difficulty. It's straight-up arcade shooter action with vertical scrolling.

It has fifteen levels of vertical scrolling shooting, five hope-shattering monsters, three upgradeable weapon kinds, each with their own sort of charge shot, three distinct pilots, each with their unique strengths, and two-player action over a network or on a single machine.
title: Active Lancer

description: DaisyQuest is an educational game intended for young children. The goal is to find the titular dragon Daisy in a magical game of hide-and-seek. While you explore the world, you come across various simple mini-games intended to test your knowledge of vowel and consonant sounds. When each mini-game is completed, a treasure will be collected which reveals part of Daisy's hiding spot. After all of the treasures have been collected, the player wins the game by finding Daisy at the revealed location.
title: DaisyQuest

description:
Elemental Force is a traditional JRPG for Mac. Set in a world ravaged by the ancient battle between gods and demons, it follows an amnesiac man named Rain who's spent the last few years living in a peaceful small village after he washed ashore there without any memories of his past. When his best friend Celia's father is killed by monsters, however, the two of them set out to understand what's happend.

The turn-based is set in a first-person perspective, very similar to Dragon Quest, while the rest of the scenes are played from an overhead perspective. The player controls the party via the mouse and selects menu options via a point-and-click interface.

sample_screenshots.caption: Exploring the world map for the first time. It's a big world out there!
Level 1 slimes, the classic RPG enemy.

title: Elemental Force

description:
The second compilation from the Apple Magic Collections series includes the following three titles:

  • Disney's Activity Center: The Lion King
  • Disney's Animated Storybook: Pocahontas
  • Disney's Screen Scenes - The Hunchback of Notre Dame

The latter is a screen-saver also available for Windows 95.
title: Apple Magic Collection 2

description: Canal Meutre is an adventure game in French. A murder has been committed in the television studio. It is up to you to solve it, despite the hostile receptionist and the TV stars unwilling to help you. The game is controlled using text input, menu structures and point-and-click elements.
title: Canal Meutre

description:
Ground Zero is a 1-player arcade game for the Macintosh.

Your spies scouted their weapons. You designed defenses to thwart those weapons. Suddenly, the warning systems have been triggered. Missiles, smart bombs, and killer satellites are homing in on your cities. The aliens are coming, and you must react fast enough to save millions of lives.

The player moves a crosshair to control three turrets at the bottom of the screen, as they try to shoot down or destroy incoming alien missiles. If the bombs reach the bottom of the screen and hit a city or turret, they are destroyed. The player has a limited number of missiles to defend themselves with each level, and receives a bonus based upon how many cities are still standing after each air raid. There are 4 levels of starting difficulty.
title: Ground Zero
James F. Dunnigan's Victory at Sea

description:
Macintosh Board Game Trio is a compilation of 3 board games previously released by Macsoft

Contains:* Monopoly

  • Risk II
  • Scrabble: CD-ROM Crossword Game
title: Macintosh Board Game Trio

description:
Macintosh Board Game Trio II is a compilation of 3 board games previously released by MacSoft

Contains:* Monopoly Here & Now

  • Scrabble for Macintosh
  • The Game of Life
title: Macintosh Board Game Trio II

description:
Macintosh Board Game Trio III is a compilation of 3 board games previously released by MacSoft

Contains:* Clue Classic

  • Scrabble Journey
  • The Original Monopoly
title: Macintosh Board Game Trio III

description: A take on the classic story of The Wizard of Oz starring Japanese singer and actress Eriko Tamura. She stars as Dorothy, who finds herself transported to a mysterious land following an accident in her home. Luckily, she has the help of a cowardly lion, a talking television and a living toaster to find her way back to her own world. This CD-ROM storybook has simple gameplay that follows a set formula. Each chapter, a story scene follows the characters on their journey as they encounter a new problem. At key moments, players can decide on the solution via multiple choice. Should they pick the wrong option, players won't lose the game; instead, they're simply given the option to try again. The game features prerendered CG art similar to Future Pirates' other games, but with a live-action Tamura interacting along with them.

sample_screenshots.caption: What will we do? Players can pick an option by choosing a character.
Following the yellow brick road to find her way home!
An encounter with a scary door!
Dorothy wakes up somewhere far from home.
The opening story scene introduces us to our characters.

title: Eriko Tamura: Oz

description:
Refixion is an experimental art game that's divided into three sections. The Anthrax Robot Works and The Anthrax Robot Works (Funny Fish MIX) are experiments in animation, sound and rhythm with minimal interactivity, while in Shangri-La you get to explore the surreal titular landscape in typical first-person point-and-click fashion. In addition, there are six music tracks that can be played from one of the game's menus.

It's one of the first titles developed by Synergy Inc., with similar aesthetics and gameplay to those of later games of theirs like L-Zone, Gadget: Invention, Travel & Adventure, and Yellow Brick Road. The game also had two sequels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Things get weird with the bouncing balls

title: Refixion

description:
Refixion II: Museum or Hospital is an exploration-focused adventure game. Much like its predecessor, gameplay involves exploring a place filled with weird and surreal stuff going on, with no puzzles. It's played from a first-person perspective and presented as a series of still images and FMVs, the latter being both live-action and 3D animations.

You start in the waiting room of the building, the titular museum or hospital, and as you get through the different passages and rooms you can look through the peepholes of different cells where short looped videos are played of costumed actors dancing. There are also strange 3D animations of what appear to be children, geometrical shapes, machines and other stuff, both inside the cells and elsewhere.

In addition, there's a feature where you can play the different songs of the soundtrack.
title: Refixion II: Museum or Hospital

description: One of the first color games ever made on a Apple Mac, Solarian II is an arcade-style space shooter. It has been maintained and updated since to continue to work on OS X machines up to 10.6 (Snow Leopard).
title: Solarian II

description:
MSFL: Pro League Football is an American football simulation for the Macintosh.

An American football league simulation, the player takes on the role of commissioner of the Micro Sports Football League, pitting 42 past super teams against each other.

The player can view each animated game over 9 - 20 minutes depending on the level of details. At the end of each game over 140 categories of stats per team per game can be printed out. Factors including temperature, wind, and precipitation can be factored into games.

Statistical reports of the strengths and weaknesses of each team can be printed out, and the player can print out statistical reports depicting the strengths and weaknesses of each team.

Compatible with Mac Pro Football
title: MSFL: Pro League Football

description:
The year is 2059. Rebel forces have stolen the controlling crystals that maintain the automated defense and supply network for the moon's 25 domed cities. With key commodities cut off, the cities are doomed. Your mission is to prevent the colonies' collapse by transporting vital goods between the cities and recovering the fiendishly hidden crystals.

The player chooses the location they wish to visit from an overhead map. Information about the population, items that are in supply and demand, and the difficulty of approach is shown. At Trade Central, the computer can purchase and sell different supplies. The ship can be refueled, and weapon systems and shielding can be purchased.

Travel between different areas is played from a side perspective, and the player controls a small spaceship that can rotate and fire in all directions, while gravity pulls it towards the bottom of the screen. Enemy ships and missile installations fire at the player, and can damage the ship, and the goal is to reach the far end of a scrolling level. The player can find space wrecks and abandoned bases as they travel to pick up more resources. The distance to the next location, time played, mini-map, and ship status is displayed at the bottom of the screen.
title: Lunar Rescue

description:
Citadel: Adventure of the Crystal Keep is a roleplaying game for Macintosh computers.

It was many years ago that the good Lady Synd and her Blood Guard were overthrown in the Citadel. During that great battle, the Citadel sank into the earth, and the depths were infested with all manners of evil. Many bands of adventurers have lost their lives trying to save Lady Synd, now imprisoned within a shimmering crystal within the labyrinth.

The player creates a party of six characters. There are raised in the nursery to allow them to spend their youth in labour, study, prayer, and play. These define the player's statistics and the characters can also devote time to studies at a later age. Characters can then choose from the classes fighter, thief, wizard, or cleric, and can later graduate to higher classes.

Within the starting village the player can visit the tavern to put together a party, the hostel to rest and train, the shop to buy, sell, and identify items, and the temple to cure, raise, or uncurse characters. The bank supplies a place to deposit, withdraw, or transfer gold.

Upon entering the Citadel game play occurs from a 1st-person perspective. Torches must be obtained and kept lit to navigate. During combat character icons must be positioned to engage in combat with enemy positions. Characters fight automatically. Different attack option can be selected from menus during combat. There are a total of 12 dungeon levels to explore and numerous puzzles to solve. The ultimate goal is to rescue Lady Synd from her crystal prison.
title: Citadel: Adventure of the Crystal Keep

description:
Make Millions is a business simulation for Macintosh.

The player takes control of a small island manufacturing company. From their business desk, the player can check current economic news and the stock market, make calls to other business associates, and check memos. The player can also set up their own account sheets to monitor industrial production. The player can purchase stocks in local companies, and if they acquire enough stocks they can begin to manage these companies as well.
title: Make Millions

description:
Moriarty's Revenge is a crime solving puzzle game for the Macintosh.

The player joins Scotland Yard as a member of The Irregulars, and tries to solve criminal cases for monetary rewards. The player receives an update on a crime in a specific city, and is issued a travel visa for certain number of days to solve it. The player can visit different sites in each city, and can gain clues by interviewing witnesses or looking for clues. Witnesses help determine the culprit's age, race, sex, weight, height, other distinguishing features, and the international criminal gang they are associated with. Clues provide information on the next location the suspect visited. The player can also bribe members of the underworld for specific physical descriptions. Each action and trip costs time, and the player must find and identify the criminal before time runs out.

The player has a notebook, where they can keep track of all suspect information. Even if the player doesn't catch the criminal, they can still receive a monetary reward for properly physically identifying them. The player can continue to take new cases for money and promotions.
title: Moriarty's Revenge

description:
Sky Shadow is a 1–2 player side-scrolling arcade game for Macintosh.

The dreaded blood-hungry Razoropers have all but destroyed the player's home city. Only an audacious bombing raid over enemy territory can save it. The player controls a spaceship that moves in all directions, fires directly forwards, and can drop bombs. The ship crosses a short horizontally-scrolling looping terrain, and gains bonus points for destroying enemy ships and successfully bombing targets. The ship has limited shield to survive a loop, and has smart bombs which can clear the screen.

After completing a loop, the player can land for bonus points, ship repairs, and weapon upgrades. Bonus healing kits can also repair the ship when it becomes damaged, and damaged vessels may lose navigation or fire control. Game speed doubles in Mega-Mode after the player reaches 100,000 points. The player starts with five ships.
title: Sky Shadow

description:
Tanaka 3D is a futuristic hover racing game with weapons. It is set in the year 2525 in the capital city of the small, fully-urbanized planet Tanaka. The people of Tanaka are very competitive and have turned their daily drives into deadly races featuring armed hover vehicles. The top three fastest survivors are rewarded cash with which to improve their rides, which can be customized to drivers' preferences.

Multiple game play modes are supported, including time trials, elimination races, and escort missions. As many as eight players can compete over LAN.
title: Tanaka 3D

description:
This is the sequel to Pararena, a shareware action game released in 1990. The new version, published commercially, adds 16-color graphics.

As in the original, the player is on a hoverboard in a bowl-shaped arena. They control their motion/direction via mouse, and must get the ball and put it in the hole.
title: Pararena 2.0

description:
Pyramid Solitaire is a 1-player card game for the Macintosh.

Twenty eight cards are dealt in the shape of a pyramid. Any card not partially covered is available for a match. The goal is to match cards with a value of 13 to remove them from the pyramid. The remaining cards can be exposed to try to find a match. Complete on-line instructions are available with the click of the mouse at any time.
title: Pyramid Solitaire

description:
Game Parlor is a collection of board games for Macintosh.

Contains chess, checkers, backgammon, solitaire, and crossword puzzles.
title: Game Parlor

description: Made in Australia, this point-and-click educational game stars a boy who adventures around his home and neighbourhood learning about the importance of safety. The player must collect objects to progress through the game such as codes and house keys, as well as solving simple safety puzzles such as wearing sandals in the backyard or putting away a set of knives in the kitchen. Each puzzle is accompanied by an illustration, sometimes graphic, of what can go wrong if the task is not completed correctly, from sunburns to a shark attack. The game came with a reference guide on first aid practices and several question and answer sheets.
title: Casualty Kid: On the Road to First-aid

description:
3 in One: Macintosh Best Sellers Collection is a compilation of three games released for the Macintosh:

  • Super Tetris
  • Hellcats Over the Pacific
  • Spectre
title: 3 in One: Macintosh Best Sellers Collection

description:
Orbquest: The Search for Seven Wards is a role-playing game for the Macintosh.

As evil threatened the land, King Cricken assembled the seven wards of an ancient orb that had the power to banish evil. Something went wrong with the casting process, causing it to explode and destroy the caster. The evil was temporarily pushed back, but has now returned. The player's goal is to gather all seven wards and defeat the evil.

The player creates their character from five races (human, elf, dwarf, hobbit, or half-orc), three classes (spellcaster, fighter, or thief) and three genders (female, male, or other). The character has six attributes: strength, intelligence, wisdom, dexterity, constitution, and charisma. The character has limited hit points, food, and gold. Experience is gained by defeating enemies.

Game play starts on the tile-based overworld that scrolls in all directions. The player explores the overworld to visit cities, castles, and dungeons. Enemies appear randomly, and in combat, the player can only attack or cast spells. When entering towns or castles, the player again enters a large tiled area that scrolls in all directions. Armor, weapons, and hints from the bar can be purchased in towns.

The goal is to visit all seven pyramids around the land, and then visiting the Island of the Mystics between each ward gathered. A new arcade or logic challenge is presented to the player between each ward gathered.
title: Orbquest: The Search for Seven Wards

description:
Mac Arcade Pak is a release of five Macintosh versions of well known arcade games.

  • Bricklayer: Tetris clone.
  • Hemiroids: An Asteroids clone.
  • Macman: Based upon Pac-Man.
  • Movod II: Two players run turrets around a circle-8 track. These turrets can be rotated to shoot at their enemy.
  • Patriot Command: Missile Command clone.
title: Mac Arcade Pak

description:
Hellcats: Missions at Leyte Gulf is an add-on for Hellcats Over the Pacific.

The player flies their F6F Hellcat during the World War II battle of Leyte Gulf. The player loads their Hellcat with either torpedoes, rockets, or bombs. The player supports a ground assault as they fly loaded with 5-inch rockets to neutralize enemy tanks and ground vehicles. The player protects their fleet positions against sub attack with a choice of conventional 500-pound bombs or torpedoes.
title: Hellcats: Missions at Leyte Gulf

description:
Solitaire Game Pack is a collection of solitaire variants for Macintosh.

  • Clock Solitaire: The game starts with 13 piles arranged like a clock, and ends when all piles become four-of-a-kind. The player loses if the fourth king turns up before all the other fours are completed.
  • Golf Solitaire: The object is to clear away 35 cards on the table by getting them to the waste pile. The more cards the player clears, the higher the score.
  • Klondike Solitaire: Try to build the four foundation piles from ace to king. The game is won if all 52 cards are moved to the foundation pile.
  • Monte Carlo: The game starts with five rows of five cards placed face up on the table. The object is to discard piles of the same rank, and the player receives 2 points for every pair discarded.
  • Patience Solitaire: The player starts with four aces placed in a row, and builds from each of these foundations to king.
title: Solitaire Game Pack

description:
Atari Arcade Classics for Macintosh is a compilation of previously released games for Macintosh.

  • Breakout
  • Centipede
  • Pong: The Next Level
title: Atari Arcade Classics for Macintosh

description: Flappy Dird is a version of Flappy Bird programmed in the Mac OS finder application. The bird is controlled by mouse clicks, and the game includes features like high score tracking.
title: Flappy Dird

description:
Fokker Triplane Flight Simulator is a 1-player flight simulator for the Macintosh.

Designed with fun in mind, the player learns to fly and operate the German Fokker Dr. 1. The player learns to take off and land, burst balloons, shoot down British Sopwith Camels, and destroy enemy fuel depots. The game includes seven different airstrips and the ability to fly under bridges. The player receives a performance score for takeoffs, landings, and kills. The dash display shows fuel, RPMs, and speed.
title: Fokker Triplane Flight Simulator

description:
Technoids is an action game for Macintosh.

The year is 2095, and distant planetary exploration is possible and necessary in order to find new planets to house Earth's overflowing population. The Federation has been formed to explore future colonization options, but they are not alone.

The Overlords, a civilization from beyond Earth's solar system are also seeking to expand, and are willing to fight for a planet where they have already established a base. From inside a mechanized battlesuit, the player must engage in combat with Overlords for each quadrant of planetary territory the Federation desires.
title: Technoids

description:
Top Ten Mac Pak II is a second compilation of 10 games for the Macintosh:

  • PGA Tour Golf III
  • Peter Pan: A Story Painting Adventure
  • Rudyard Kipling's The Jungle Book
  • Putt-Putt and Fatty Bear's Activity Pack
  • Shockwave Assault
  • Spaceship Warlock
  • Super Wing Commander
  • Wing Commander III: Heart of the Tiger
  • Wolf Pack
title: Top Ten Mac Pak II

description:
Crystal Crazy: The Quest Continues is an arcade game for the Macintosh.

The player controls a cow in a UFO that moves in multiple directions and must avoid and shoot the enemies on screen. Each level has a different objective, such as collecting all the crystals, smashing all the objects against the walls, causing pictures to appear by moving over them, or rearranging jigsaw pieces to create pictures.

Numerous helpful items can be picked up, including: free ships, bonus crystals, a smart bomb that destroys all enemies on the screen, and an exit anchor that prevents gateways from moving. The player can also obtain a number of special guns, including: the captivator, which slows down enemies, a super-gun which shoots more and faster explosive shots which kill one enemy and hits more with shrapnel, the multi-gun which shoots in multiple destructions, and guided missiles which shoot the nearest enemy. There are also five different types of shields to protect the player.
title: Crystal Crazy: The Quest Continues

description:
The game Macintosh Spiele Klassiker is a compilation containing mainly shareware and public domain software originally released for Apple Macintosh. In its 160 games it puts the focus on low cost software.

A variety of genres is represented: Board and card games, action and adventure games as well as gambling, sports and strategy games.
title: Macintosh Spiele Klassiker

description:
In MegaSimpsonHomer, your goal is to guide Homer Simpson to the exit on each level. Homer can move in eight directions, using the keypad or mouse. Standing in his way are nuclear power plants, which will take away a life if they attack. Homer can attack them back, but it doesn't always work. Donuts can be picked up for extra points. The game ends when you run out of lives. There is a high score table.

MegaSimpsonHomer was distributed as Shareware, but without restrictions.

sample_screenshots.caption: New level, starting out next to an enemy, with two more waiting nearby

title: MegaSimpsonHomer

description:
A version of Gunshy, one of the oldest versions of Shanghai, with the tileset changed into Simpsons characters.

There are four different Bart tiles that match each other, as do the pairings of Sherri and Terri, Patty and Selma, and Itchy and Scratchy. All other matches are between identical tiles.

sample_screenshots.caption: Much better the second time around

title: Simpsons Gunshy

description:
Casino Action is a compilation of 40 arcade and casino games for Macintosh.

  • Aldrich's Solitaire
  • Blackjack Deluxe
  • Blackjack 4.0
  • Calculation 5.1
  • Canfield

description:
Star Wars: Mac Pack is a compilation of two previously-released Star Wars games for Macintosh.

  • Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
  • Star Wars: Empire at War
title: Star Wars: Mac Pack

description:
Macintosh Game Pack is a compilation of three games:

  • Diamonds: A game where the player controls a bouncing ball to remove blocks from the screen in order.
  • Jewelbox: A Columns clone
  • Sparkz: A Qix clone
title: Macintosh Game Pack

description:
This retail compilation contains 11 strategy games developed by Strategic Studies Group for Macintosh.

  • Carriers at War
  • Carriers at War II
  • Decisive Battles of the American Civil War, Volume One
  • Decisive Battles of the American Civil War, Vol. 2
  • Decisive Battles of the American Civil War, Vol. 3
  • Gold of the Americas: The Conquest of the New World
  • Halls of Montezuma: A Battle History of the United States Marine Corps
  • MacArthur's War: Battles for Korea
  • Panzer Battles
  • Rommel: Battles for North Africa
  • Warlords
title: Total War!

description:
Macintosh Game Pak is a compilation containing:

  • Masque Solitaire Antics
  • World Series of Poker: Deluxe Casino Pak
title: Macintosh Game Pak

description:
Sports Night is a collection of 19 shareware sports games for the Macintosh.

  • 3D Paddlebash
  • 8-Ball
  • Betmaster
  • Dirt Bike
  • Billiard Parlour
  • F.A.S. Soccer
  • FIGP
  • Football 95
  • Gopher Golf
  • Henna Derby
  • Karate Champs
  • Mac Ski
  • Mac QB
  • Sail Away
  • Silicon Volleyball
  • Sky Dive
  • Rotis
  • Vic Kombat
title: Sports Night

description: In the final volume of the Lost & Found trilogy, Zach present the player with new puzzles in twelve themed scenes, such as Paper Crafts and Model Toys. The idea is to find eight random objects hidden each scene, provided with clues on what to look for, and a couple of tools; the flashlight and magnifying glass to aid in the search.
title: Lost & Found: Volume 3

description:
Mac Tonka Truck Pack is a compilation of two previously released games for Macintosh:

  • Tonka Construction
  • Tonka Search & Rescue
title: Mac Tonka Truck Pack

description:
Bomber is a 1-player Macintosh simulation of a B-17 bombing mission over Europe during World War II. The game was originally released in black and white, but later upgraded for color devices.

The player takes on the roles of pilot, co-pilot, bomber, navigator, and gunner of the aircraft. During pilot control, the player controls the flight of their aircraft from a cockpit perspective. Under the bomber role, the player tries to visually find their designated targets from altitude and release bombs. When engaging with enemy aircraft, the player takes on the role of one of the six gunners on the aircraft. The navigator uses maps to plan their flight over Europe to reach targets.

Players gain promotions for successful missions, but crew members can be killed in combat. The goal is to survive a total of 25 missions to return safely to America.
title: Bomber

description:
D!Zone Mac is a collection of levels and utilities for The Ultimate Doom on Macintosh.

Contains 1000 Doom and 1,000 The Ultimate Doom levels, as well as the program D!Mac to load the levels.
title: D!Zone Mac

description:
Carmen Sandiego: Math Detective is an educational math game for Windows and Macintosh.

Carmen Sandiego has invented the Quantum Chrystalizer Machine and shrunk 12 of the world's famous landmarks into crystals. Agent 9 must travel to the headquarters of Carmen Sandiego's various henchmen to solve math-related mini-games, obtain secret passcodes, and recover the stolen monuments. The player must recover the Golden Gate Bridge, Angel Falls, the Great Wall of China, Ayers Rock, the Hubble Space Telescope, Mount Everest, the Caspian Sea, Petronas Towers, the Great Barrier Reef, the Grand Canyon, the Nile River, and the Roman Coliseum.

There are three levels of game difficulty. Mini-games include:

  • Atom Smasher: Solve math problems from a series of rotating answers.
  • Crimewave Sensor: Choose answers to solve math problems.
  • Light Spectrometer: The player adds numbered lenses to focus light beams in a Tower of Hanoi puzzle.
  • Microchip Decoder: Draw lines between points, and answer questions about the resulting shape.
  • Molecular Scope: Solve word problems displayed as a crossword puzzle.
title: Carmen Sandiego: Math Detective

description:
Power Play: 3 Great Flight Sims is a compilation of three previously-released flight simulations for Macintosh.

  • Absolute Zero
  • Flying Nightmares
  • Out of the Sun
title: Power Play: 3 Great Flight Sims

description:
Arcade Battles is a collection of 48 arcade games for Macintosh.

  • 3D Puzzle Bash
  • Asterax
  • Bachman

  • Beamwars

  • Billiard Parlour

description:
The Pangea Super Pack is a collection of five previously-released Macintosh games.

  • Billy Frontier
  • Bugdom 2
  • Cro-Mag Rally
  • Enigmo
  • Otto Matic
title: The Pangea Super Pack

description: Astrorock 2000 is the successor of Astrorock. The story, which is only featured on promotional material, features hero Zed Nepher who once again has to blast invading aliens. The game itself is almost identical to the predecessor and only adds additional power-ups (e.g. AI bots or the new Pulse-Neutron Discharge Cannon), updated UI graphics, difficulty settings and an autoshield option.
title: Astrorock 2000

description:
Smash Hit Racquetball! is a 1–2 player racquetball game for the Macintosh.

Two players compete at racquetball from a perspective behind the players. Competing against the computer, multiplayer over modem, or direct connection between two computers is available. The main screen shows a 3D view of the racquetball court, while an overhead view shows the position of the ball and the players. Player movement is controlled with the mouse, while the keyboard is used to direct ball movement. There are four levels of computer difficulty, a practice mode for serving or receiving, and an option to replay up to 30 seconds of gameplay.
title: Smash Hit Racquetball!
